Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani singled in the go-ahead run before stealing his 56th base of the season in the sixth inning.
Adrián Morejón's 101-mph fastball struck out Donovan Solano to end the game.
Michael Kopech walked Jake Cronenworth to put the tying run aboard.
Brandon Lockridge stole second but Donovan Solano struck out swinging to end the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Mike Shildt said, ‘We’re playing for the division, it’s a little bit out of our hands as far as the destiny goes (but) we still have a shot at it, for sure.’
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres’ five-game winning streak ended.
Teoscar Hernández’s two-strike, two-out RBI single scored Shohei Ohtani, who walked and took second on Dylan Cease’s wild pitch in the first.
Xander Bogaerts had an RBI single and Cronenworth followed with an RBI groundout as the Padres quickly took a 2-1 lead in the second.
A 448-foot shot from Fernando Tatis Jr. tied the game at 3-3 with two outs in the fifth.
